generalInfo:
This varied, exciting trip combines Nicaragua's beautiful colonial cities, wildlife rich nature reserves, volcanic islands, impressive scenery and culture and traditions with an adventurous twist.

Your trip starts in Nicaragua’s capital, Managua, from where you travel onto Léon, the intellectual heart of the country via the ruins of Léon Viejo, a UNESCO world heritage site. You explore the Juan Venado nature reserve by boat hoping to spot caiman, iguanas and turtles (between May – November). Next travel on to Ometepe – an island of two volcanic peaks rising dramatically from Lake Nicaragua, the largest lake in Central America. Kayak through its wetlands, hike to a waterfall and visit its villages and sacred lake. Visit the Montibello nature reserve for a hike through tropical dry-forest, before continuing on to the splendid colonial town of Granada from where you visit the craft market of Masaya, tour the Las Isletas freshwater archipelago by boat, hike on the slopes of the Mombacho volcano and visit the Masaya volcano by night to see a colony of bats and molten magma glowing deep down inside the volcano crater.
You end with some beach time on the low-key Corn Islands , 70km off Nicaragua’s Caribbean coast, where you can relax, snorkel or dive.

This two week itinerary is ideal for adventurous couples, friends and families. It is a tailormade itinerary and can be modified in any way you wish.

When to visit:

A short dry season: December - to mid-May. The Pacific basin in Western Nicaragua, where the historic towns are situated, has a more pronounced dry season, at its height it can be too hot for some.

Rainy or 'green season': mid-May - mid-November. In the green season the mornings are almost always clear and warm, and in the afternoon you may get a short, strong burst of rain, with clouds usually clearing in time for a magnificent sunset. The rains tend to be heaviest in September and October

dayInfo.description: Managua City tour, onwards to Leon. In the morning you will be taken on a private guided city tour of Managua, visiting notable sights such as the hilltop memorial to Sandino, the central market, the ultra modern cathedral and the 6,000-year old stone-age footprints of a family moving across ancient mud flats at Acahualinca. In the afternoon you will be taken to visit to Leon Vijeo, Nicaragua’s first capital. It was founded by the Spanish in 1524 on the site of an indigenous village in a rich, fertile valley at the end of Lake Managua, just across the water from looming Momotombo and Momotombito volcanoes. In 1610 the entire city was evacuated to its current location. Six months later the volcano erupted and León Viejo was covered with ash and lava. It took until 1967 to find the ruins of the original city. The site is a UNESCO world heritage site and excavations are underway. Already the foundations of homes, the country’s first mint, a church, a convent, a brothel, and the cathedral where the conquistador Cordoba is buried have been uncovered. There will be time to try the local delicacy, quesillo (a soft tortilla wrap filled with the local mozzarella-like cheese, chopped onion and tomato in a cream sauce) and sample tiste a chocolate-flavoured corn drink served in a gourd, before continuing to León where you stay for 2 nights.

Juan Venado Reserve boat trip. Today visit Isla Juan Venado Nature Reserve, a Pacific coastal wetland where there are chances to see an abundance of wildlife including cayman, crocodiles, iguanas, crustaceans and other marine creatures. The sand spit is also a vital nesting site for Olive Ridley sea turtles (from May to November). Return back to Leon City where you have the afternoon free.

Ometepe Island. Today you will be transferred to San Jorge, near Rivas to catch a ferry to Moyogalpa on Ometepe Island. You are met on arrival by a local driver who will transfer you across the island to a delightful small eco-lodge where you stay for 3 nights. In the afternoon you will be taken on a shared kayaking tour, passing through wetlands across the centre of the island, home to waterbirds, cayman, crocodiles, turtles and monkeys. After the tour return to the lodge, where you have the remaining evening free.

Ometepe Island tour. Today you are taken on a shared tour of the island. Including visits to Laguna Charco Verde a mysterious pond of dark green water said to contain an enchanted city, then travelling to the far end of the island for a good view of Maderas volcano and the village of Altagracia where some basalt idols and petroglyphs are found beside the catholic church.

Hike to San Ramon waterfall. This morning you have a strenuous hike to the impressive San Ramon waterfall, on the slopes of Maderas Volcano. Bathe at the foot of the falls or take a refreshing shower under the 120m tall flow of water. Hike back to the lodge, where you have the remaining afternoon free.

Montibelli Nature Reserve and Masaya artisan market. Today catch the ferry back to the mainland where you are met and taken to the Montibelli Reserve, a 160 hectares wildlife-rich private tropical dry forest reserve where you will hike one of the trails with a local guide. Afterwards you will be taken to Masaya to see the artisan market where you will have the chance to buy some local arts and crafts. From here you will be transferred to the picturesque historic city of Granada where you stay for 2 nights at one of the converted colonial hotels in the historic centre of the city.

Granada city tour and Las Isletas boat tour. Morning free in Granada. In the afternoon you will be collected from your hotel for a horse drawn carriage ride around the town. You will then be taken on a boat tour of Las Isletas, a freshwater archipelago of 354 rocky islands in Lake Nicaragua. Here at dusk you can watch the water birds come to roost, and admire some of the wealthy citizens homes on these private islands.

Mombacho Volcano - crater trail & Masaya night tour - ending in Managua. In the morning hike on the slopes of the nearby Mombacho volcano. You can choose between an easy 30 minute stroll on the coffee trail, a medium walk 1hr 30 mins along the crater trail or a strenuous 4hr hike on the Puma Trail. Whichever you choose your local guide will tell you about the flora, the fauna, the people who once inhabited the area and the vulcanology. There are cloud forests on the upper slopes and on a clear day from the top of the Puma Trail impressive views back down upon the city of Granada and of Lake Nicaragua. There will be some free time later in the day to enjoy the city and perhaps some of its museums. In the late afternoon you are picked up from the hotel and taken to Masaya Volcano. Parakeets fly in to roost as the sun sets, where you await the exodus of thousands of bats from a lava tube on the volcano's flank, on their nightly foragings. The intrepid can don hard hats and masks to explore the tube. Up on the crater's rim, molten magma may be seen glowing deep below After the tour you are transferred back to Managua for a positioning night before your flight to the Corn Islands in the morning

Corn Islands. Early start this morning to catch your 1h 30m flight to Big Corn Island. You will met on arrival and transferred to Arenas Beach, Big Corn's most beautiful beach with white sands, crystal clear calm turquoise water and beautiful sunsets over the Caribbean. Stay for the next 3 nights at a beachfront hotel. Rest of the day free to relax.

Free day. Simply relax at the beach or perhaps explore the island independently e.g. you can fix up locally for a Creole English speaking taxi driver to take you on a tour of the island, or to transfer you up to the north of the island where there are good snorkelling opportunities. or if seas are calm make a short visit to Little Corn Island - catching the morning boat to buzz over for a couple of hours prior to the daily return around lunchtime (avoid in Jan and Feb when its windiest and therefore the sea quite choppy unless you have good sea legs). Those with a PADI licence may wish to add a day's diving.
Free day. Relax the beach or perhaps explore the island independently

Return to Managua. Morning free to relax. In the afternoon you will be transferred to Big Corn airstrip for the afternoon flight to Managua You will be met on arrival and transferred to Managua city for a positioning night before your international flight the following day.
Depart Nicaragua. Transfer to Managua airport to catch your onwards international flight
